remarks: Mayet's equation E^*_3, derived from E_3.  Solution, for n = 3, to open problem in Remark (b) after Theorem 7.1 of [Mayet3] p. 1240. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-2009.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
mayetes3.a $e |- A e. CH $.
mayetes3.b $e |- B e. CH $.
mayetes3.c $e |- C e. CH $.
mayetes3.d $e |- D e. CH $.
mayetes3.f $e |- F e. CH $.
mayetes3.g $e |- G e. CH $.
mayetes3.r $e |- R e. CH $.
mayetes3.ac $e |- A C_ ( _|_ ` C ) $.
mayetes3.af $e |- A C_ ( _|_ ` F ) $.
mayetes3.cf $e |- C C_ ( _|_ ` F ) $.
mayetes3.ab $e |- A C_ ( _|_ ` B ) $.
mayetes3.cd $e |- C C_ ( _|_ ` D ) $.
mayetes3.fg $e |- F C_ ( _|_ ` G ) $.
mayetes3.rx $e |- R C_ ( _|_ ` X ) $.
mayetes3.x $e |- X = ( ( A vH C ) vH F ) $.
mayetes3.y $e |- Y = ( ( ( A vH B ) i^i ( C vH D ) ) i^i ( F vH G ) ) $.
mayetes3.z $e |- Z = ( ( B vH D ) vH G ) $.
mayetes3i $p |- ( ( X vH R ) i^i Y ) C_ ( Z vH R ) $.
